title: Core Actor Definitions - Provider, Deployer, Operator, Others

provider.definition: A natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body that develops an AI system or a general-purpose AI model or that has an AI system or a general-purpose AI model developed and places it on the market or puts the AI system into service under its own name or trademark, whether for payment or free of charge

conditions.element: Natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body
Develops an AI system or GP AI model
Places on market OR puts into service
Under own name or trademark
Whether for payment or free of charge

alternative_pathways.description: Entity that has system developed (outsources) AND commercializes

conditions.element: Natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body
Has an AI system or GP AI model developed
conditions.flag: MEDIUM_CONFIDENCE: Who is 'provider' when development outsourced? Entity commissioning development.

conditions.element: Places on market OR puts into service
Under own name or trademark
conditions.critical: This is key - name/trademark determines provider status

critical_elements: Commercialization (market placement or putting into service)
provider.exclusions_implied: Entity that only deploys someone else's system = deployer not provider (unless becomes provider via substantial modification per Art 3(23))

deployer.definition: A natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body using an AI system under its authority except where the AI system is used in the course of a personal non-professional activity

conditions.element: Natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body
Using an AI system
Under its authority
conditions.flag: MEDIUM_CONFIDENCE: 'under its authority' - control/direction test? Employee using tool = employer is deployer?

exclusion.text: Except where AI system used in course of personal non-professional activity

deployer.can_overlap: Yes - entity can be both provider (of system A) and deployer (of system B)

authorised_representative.definition: A natural or legal person located or established in the Union who has received and accepted a written mandate from a provider of an AI system or a general-purpose AI model to, respectively, perform and carry out on its behalf the obligations and procedures established by this Regulation

conditions.element: Natural or legal person
Located or established in the Union
Has received and accepted a written mandate
From a provider of AI system or GP AI model
To perform and carry out on provider's behalf obligations and procedures

authorised_representative.purpose: EU compliance representative for non-EU providers

importer.definition: A natural or legal person located or established in the Union that places on the market an AI system that bears the name or trademark of a natural or legal person established in a third country

conditions.element: Natural or legal person
Located or established in the Union
Places on the market an AI system
System bears name or trademark of person established in third country

importer.function: EU market entry point for third-country systems

distributor.definition: A natural or legal person in the supply chain, other than the provider or the importer, that makes an AI system available on the Union market

conditions.element: Natural or legal person
In the supply chain
Other than the provider or the importer
Makes an AI system available on the Union market

operator.definition: A provider, product manufacturer, deployer, authorised representative, importer or distributor
operator.purpose: Collective term for all actors with regulatory obligations
operator.note: 'Product manufacturer' mentioned here but not separately defined in Art 3 - implicit definition

critical_insights.provider_vs_deployer: Provider = makes/markets, Deployer = uses. Mutually exclusive for same system but entity can be both for different systems.
critical_insights.name_trademark_test: Entity placing system on market under own name/trademark = provider (even if didn't develop)
critical_insights.supply_chain_sequence: Provider → Importer (if third country) → Distributor → Deployer
critical_insights.authority_test: Deployer uses 'under its authority' - control/direction determines deployer status

interpretative_questions: Product manufacturer role when AI embedded in product?
Substantial modification turning deployer into provider (Art 3(23))?
Open source - who is provider if no single entity placing on market?
